body:
This issue needs a better description.

@gitbugr Would you like to add a summary, how to reproduce, the current behavior and the expected behavior to this issue? Having a code example or a PR with a failing test is helpful too.

@SenseException Sure.

The most basic example of reproducing what is happening above would be: 

```php
$query = $em->createQuery('SELECT COUNT(u.id), u.age AS HIDDEN userAge FROM MyProject\Model\User u HAVING userAge > 20');

$result = $query->getResult();
/**
 *  $result = [
 *    0 => [ 
 *      1 => 1234 
 *    ]
 *  ]
 */

$singleScalarResult = $query->getSingleScalarResult(); // error due to structure of result above
```

The error returned when running `getSingleScalarResult();` would be 
```
Doctrine\ORM\NonUniqueResultException

The query returned a row containing multiple columns. Change the query or use a different result function like getScalarResult().
```

Expected behaviour would be for the result of `getResult();` to be:
```php
/**
 *  $result = [
 *    0 => [ 
 *      0 => 1234 
 *    ]
 *  ]
 */
```
and the result of `getSingleScalarResult();` to be `1234`

Same problem here, using doctrine v2.10.1, calling `getSingleScalarResult` when loading `count`, while using another AS HIDDEN attribute, getting the following message:

`The query returned a row containing multiple columns. Change the query or use a different result function like getScalarResult().`

At `\Doctrine\ORM\Internal\Hydration\SingleScalarHydrator.php 51`

issue.title: Fix Hidden fields triggering error when using getSingleScalarResult()
issue.body:
Using HIDDEN fields in a request was causing the "unicity" check to fail and throw a NonUniqueResultException, because we were counting raw data instead of counting gathered row data.

See https://github.com/doctrine/orm/issues/4257  for original issue.


_PS: sorry if I've done something wrong in the contribution procedure, it's my first pull request :)_

body: I've submitted a fix to this issue: https://github.com/doctrine/orm/pull/8340

issue.title: "The query returned a row containing multiple columns." using HYDRATE_SINGLE_SCALAR with a hidden column
issue.body:
### Bug Report

|    Q        |   A
|------------ | ------
| BC Break    | no
| Version     | 2.10.1

#### Summary

While trying to get a list of ID for one entity, I tried to use `getResult(AbstractQuery::HYDRATE_SINGLE_SCALAR)`, one column is visible, the other is hidden, it seems an issue for Doctrine but it should work.

#### Current behavior

Doctrine throws exception about multiple column selected while using HYDRATE_SINGLE_SCALAR but only one is visible, the other is hidden.
The error is

> The query returned a row containing multiple columns. Change the query or use a different result function like getScalarResult().

#### How to reproduce

Select 2 columns, one visible, other is hidden.
Get a list of first column, using `getResult(AbstractQuery::HYDRATE_SINGLE_SCALAR)`

$qb->select('entity.id AS id');
$qb->select('entity.id AS HIDDEN otherId');
$idList = $qb->getQuery()->getResult(AbstractQuery::HYDRATE_SINGLE_SCALAR);

#### Expected behavior

I get a list of IDs with no error.

body: Actually, it has been merged in the wrong branch :sweat_smile: 2.7 vs 2.7.x

issue.title: Merge 2.7 into 2.10.x
issue.body:
2.7 should never have existed, things that have been merged into it have been lost (and were never released).

Fixes #4257 
Fixes #7512
Closes #7514
